page.title: 20TRANSPORT IN CALLANDER
page.content: Apart from trains and planes,all other means of transport are used in Callander. Most homes have at least one car and many have two.This is because many men travel all over Scotland.There is only an hourly bus service to the nearest town and several families live outwith the bus service.Many lorries seen in the town are only passing through to and from the north.Some bring the usual services to th town.Those involved with local farming take animals to the Stirling Auction Market and transport milk and hay. All the usual {vans}may be seen-tradesmen,milk,post,ice cream,fish,and bread.In the summer,many{touring buses}stop here to augment the number of mini,post,school and service buses.There are 3taxis,1 fire engine and 1ambulance.
